Package game.actors.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.actors.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.capabilities.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.displays.Printable, Resettable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Goomba, Koopa
public abstract class Enemy
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
implements Resettable
This class is the generic class for an enemy class that would form the base for all enemies moving forwards

      displayChar - the character that will represent the Actor in the display

    • playTurn

      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()

      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written

    • isConscious

      public boolean isConscious()
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Is this Actor conscious? Returns true if the current Actor has positive hit points. Actors on zero hit points are deemed to be unconscious. Depending on the game client, this status may be interpreted as either unconsciousness or death, or inflict some other kind of status.
      Overrides:
      isConscious in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Returns:
      true if and only if hitPoints is positive.

    • increaseMaxHp

      public void increaseMaxHp​(int points)
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Increases maximum hit points and set current hit points to that new maximum hit points.
      Overrides:
      increaseMaxHp in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Parameters:
      points - number of points that is added to maximum health

    • resetMaxHp

      public void resetMaxHp​(int hitPoints)
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      reset maximum hit points and set current hit points to that new max hit points.
      Overrides:
      resetMaxHp in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Parameters:
      hitPoints - integer value of new maximum hit points

    • heal

      public void heal​(int points)
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Add points to the current Actor's hitpoint total. This cannot take the hitpoints over the Actor's maximum. If there is an overflow, hitpoints are silently capped at the maximum. Does not check for consciousness: unconscious Actors can still be healed if the game client allows.
      Overrides:
      heal in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Parameters:
      points - number of hitpoints to add.

    • hurt

      public void hurt​(int points)
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Do some damage to the current Actor. If the Actor's hitpoints go down to zero, it will be knocked out.
      Overrides:
      hurt in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Parameters:
      points - number of hitpoints to deduct.

    • getWeapon

      public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.weapons.Weapon getWeapon()
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Get the weapon this Actor is using. If the current Actor is carrying weapons, returns the first one in the inventory. Otherwise, returns the Actor's natural fighting equipment e.g. fists.
      Overrides:
      getWeapon in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Returns:
      the Actor's weapon or natural

    • getIntrinsicWeapon

      protected edu.monash.fit2099.engine.weapons.IntrinsicWeapon getIntrinsicWeapon()
      Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Creates and returns an intrinsic weapon. By default, the Actor 'punches' for 5 damage. Override this method to create an Actor with more interesting descriptions and/or different damage.
      Overrides:
      getIntrinsicWeapon in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
      Returns:
      a freshly-instantiated IntrinsicWeapon
